1050/A0/05/882/001.headline: UNICEF Cuba supported MoE-led capacity strengthening initiatives reaching of ECD practitioners in six provinces testing an updated ECD curriculum with an integrated  multi-disciplinary approach informed through community participation.

1050/A0/05/883/005.indicator_name: Percentage of children  adolescents and adults from priority areas and groups who know the rights stated in the CRC and the national legislation.
1050/A0/05/883/005.headline: In 2016  UNICEF Cuba continued to work in partnership with the Ministry of Justice (within the framework of the For a Right World initiative) and the Youth Studies Center to expand the promotion of children rights and to generate evidence on behavioral trends of Cuban adolescents.

1050/A0/05/883/004.indicator_name: Percentage of staff from protection institutions and social agents trained to include in their daily practices updated information and specialized preparation for children and adolescents under their responsibility.
1050/A0/05/883/004.headline: In the reporting year  UNICEF Cuba and the Ministry of the Interior partnered to jointly hold capacity building initiatives on comprehensive protection of children  with a rights-based approach  incorporating international standards.

1050/A0/05/883/003.indicator_name: Percentage of staff from homes for children without parental care and social agents trained to include in their daily practices updated information and specialized preparation for children and adolescents under their responsibility.
